column1:
PooPotato,"2015-05-09T00:14:48.397Z","Hey! I Saw That Guy in The Movie For Three Seconds!","

When I was first sent the postcard from Lego reminding me of the May 4th sales, I was really kind of disappointed by the exclusive minifigure they were giving out this year.
column2: Although Admiral Yularen did play a big role in the Clone Wars TV show, he is only in the original trilogy for a couple of seconds, during the famous&nbsp
column3: Death Star meeting in Episode IV. &nbsp
column5: t going to try to reach the $75 in order to get him for free, but realizing how close I was to $75 anyway, I caved in and bought the Shadow Troopers Battlepack to compensate.

column1: This minifigure matches the source material to the T.
column2: If you go on wookieepedia.com, as I&#39
column3: m sure many of you Star Wars fans do, you can see a picture of Yularen during A New Hope, and he is very well replicated in this minifigure.

column1: When compared to the other exclusive minifigures that I own, such as Darth Revan, this was probably one of the least interesting ones.
column3: s not like Yularen was ever in any big action scenes or battles, so kids are definitely not going to know who he is. &nbsp
column4: Luckily, my Death Star Conference Room has been dying for more Imperial officers, so Yularen did end up finding a home. &nbsp
column5: I wish Lego had made a better choice though, such as Commander Cody, the bartender from A New Hope, or Aunt Beru. &nbsp
column6: However, it was free, and that should be good enough for anybody.

column1: Dozens of other far more interesting options
